comments.body: Is this a bug?  Why can't an app show the keyboard before Flutter is ready?

I think it's likely a bug, but I'm not sure if it's in us or Android. When I've tried to examine this with a step debugger everything "works," so I haven't been able to figure out if it's the IMM deciding to never show the keyboard in the first place for mysterious reasons or the keyboard showing and then being immediately hidden faster than I can see/what renders based at least tangentially on our behavior. There isn't any code in the embedding that "should" hide the keyboard here, so it's some device specific second order interaction. And probably racy since it doesn't reproduce in the debugger.

It seems a little similar to #34169, but different because we're not actually focusing into a text field from a platform view here.
Perhaps the keyboard is getting hidden from the fuzzer tapping randomly (and maybe tapping on the text input and then away from it...)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +16,20 @@    // Triggers the Android keyboard, which causes the resize of the Flutter view.
    // We need to wait for the app to complete.
    MethodChannel(getFlutterView(), "com.example.abstract_method_smoke_test")
        .setMethodCallHandler({ call, result ->
          toggleInput()

comments.body: not sure if the empty `dispose()` is needed, but just in case.
Hard to tell in Kotlin, but the original class is a Java interface so it's still needed here.
There has been an API change to `flutterEngine.getDartExecutor().getBinaryMessenger()`. Should we make that change now? Or should we come back later and update?
will follow up with that while the device lab tests are running.
